subject: Politics
title: Government Transparency
description: A quick win: understand Government Transparency.

hook.text: Sweden made government documents public in 1766. Most countries took two more centuries to follow.

buildup.text: Transparency means citizens can see how government spends money, makes decisions, and uses power.

discovery.text: Freedom of information laws in over 100 countries let citizens request government documents.

twist.text: Governments resist transparency. They delay requests, redact heavily, and charge steep fees.

climax.text: Estonia digitized its government. Citizens track every official action online in real time.

punchline.text: Sunlight disinfects corruption. Secrecy lets it spread.

quiz.question: Which country was the first to make government documents public?
